skill.name: sandbox-configurator
skill.description: Configure Claude Code sandbox security with file system and network isolation boundaries
skill.summary: Configure Claude Code sandbox security with file system and network isolation boundaries
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation skill containing configuration templates and guidance. No executable code, file access, network calls, or command execution capabilities. All content is publicly documented in SKILL.md.

content.value_statement: Claude Code sandbox configuration is complex and security trade-offs are unclear. This skill provides a specialist agent that analyzes your development needs and generates appropriate sandbox configurations with four security levels from maximum isolation to development mode.
actual_capabilities: Analyze security requirements and recommend appropriate sandbox level
Generate JSON configuration for file access, network, and command restrictions
Define trusted domains for package registries and internal services
Configure Docker integration and local development server access
Document security trade-offs for each configuration choice
Validate configuration against development workflow requirements
limitations: Only configures Claude Code sandbox settings, does not modify system files
Requires manual application of generated settings to .claude/settings.local.json
Does not verify or enforce compliance with organizational security policies
Cannot detect or prevent runtime security violations by other code

use_cases.title: Enterprise security compliance
use_cases.description: Configure strict sandbox settings for regulated environments with internal registries and minimal permissions

use_cases.title: Public repo safety
use_cases.description: Apply maximum security level when contributing to public repositories to prevent prompt injection attacks

use_cases.title: Development workflow balance
use_cases.description: Enable Docker and local servers while maintaining controlled network access for development

prompt_templates.title: Enterprise config
prompt_templates.prompt: Configure sandbox for enterprise with internal registries at *.company.com and registry.company.internal, enable Docker and Git, allow local binding, add NPM_TOKEN and COMPANY_API_KEY environment variables

prompt_templates.title: Security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my current sandbox configuration and recommend improvements for secure open source contribution

prompt_templates.prompt: Set up development mode sandbox with auto-allow bash, full Docker integration, and local binding enabled

output_examples.input: Configure sandbox with balanced security for full-stack development
output: Sandbox: Enabled with auto-allow for trusted operations
Network: Custom domains enabled for npm and GitHub registries
Local Binding: Allowed for development servers
Excluded Commands: git, docker (Unix sockets enabled)

best_practices: Start with maximum security and only add permissions when specifically required by your workflow
Keep trusted domain lists minimal and avoid adding unnecessary external services
Document the security trade-offs when configuring exceptions for development needs
anti_patterns: Using no sandbox mode for routine development tasks
Adding broad wildcard domains like * to trusted domains without verification
Leaving sensitive values like API keys in environment variables without reviewing access

faq.question: Which security level should I choose?
faq.answer: Start with Maximum Security for public projects. Use Balanced Security for routine development. Development Mode only for fully trusted environments with controlled code.

faq.question: What domains should I add to trusted domains?
faq.answer: Only add domains you explicitly need such as npm registries, GitHub, or internal documentation servers. Avoid adding domains you do not recognize or use rarely.

faq.question: Can I use environment variables safely?
faq.answer: Yes but never store secrets like API keys or tokens directly. Use placeholder values and set actual secrets through your CI system or shell environment.

faq.question: What happens if I disable the sandbox?
faq.answer: Disabling sandbox removes all isolation boundaries. Claude Code gains direct system access which increases risk of prompt injection attacks executing harmful commands.

faq.question: How do I verify Git and Docker work with my config?
faq.answer: The skill provides validation test commands. Run git status to test Git operations and docker ps to test Docker access. Add them to excludedCommands if blocked.

faq.question: What is the difference between Level 1 and Level 2?
faq.answer: Level 1 blocks local binding and has minimal exclusions. Level 2 allows local binding for dev servers, adds custom network domains, and enables Docker via Unix sockets.
